definition[0]: a piece of equipment used to cut off the heads of criminals, especially in France in the past
definition[1]: a piece of equipment used to cut large sheets of paper
definition[2]: the setting of a time limit on a discussion in the British Parliament
example[0]: Opposition leaders accused the government of introducing a guillotine motion to stifle debate.
definition[3]: to cut off someoneâ€™s head using a guillotine
definition[4]: to limit the period of time allowed for the discussion of a possible new law in the British Parliament
